org.apache.sysds.runtime.compress.colgroup

Class AColGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.sysds.runtime.compress.colgroup.AColGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColGroupUncompressed, ColGroupValue

    public abstract class AColGroup
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Class that stores information about a column group within a compressed matrix block. There are subclasses specific to each compression type.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AColGroup.ColGroupType
      Concrete ColGroupType Protected such that outside the ColGroup package it should be unknown which specific subtype is used.
      static class  AColGroup.CompressionType
      Public Group types supported Note For instance DDC is called DDC not DDC1, or DDC2 which is a specific subtype of the DDC.

                              int rl,
                              int ru)
        Decompress the contents of this column group into the specified full matrix block.
        Parameters:
        target - a matrix block where the columns covered by this column group have not yet been filled in.
        rl - row lower
        ru - row upper

      • decompressToBlock

        public void decompressToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                              int rl,
                              int ru,
                              int offT)
        Decompress the contents of this column group into the specified full matrix block.
        Parameters:
        target - a matrix block where the columns covered by this column group have not yet been filled in.
        rl - The row to start at
        ru - The row to end at
        offT - The rowOffset into target to decompress to.

      • decompressToBlock

        public void decompressToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                              int rl,
                              int ru,
                              double[] values,
                              boolean safe)
        Decompress the contents of this column group into the target matrixBlock, it is assumed that the target matrix Block have the same number of columns and at least the number of rows ru.
        Parameters:
        target - The target matrixBlock to decompress into
        rl - The row to start at
        ru - The row to end at
        values - The dictionary values materialized.
        safe - Boolean specifying if the operation should be safe, aka counting nnz.

                              int ru,

      • decompressToBlockSafe

        public abstract void decompressToBlockSafe(MatrixBlock target,
                                           int rl,
                                           int ru,
                                           int offT,
                                           double[] values)
        Decompress the contents of this column group into the specified full matrix block without managing the number of non zeros.
        Parameters:
        target - a matrix block where the columns covered by this column group have not yet been filled in.
        rl - row lower
        ru - row upper
        offT - Offset into target to assign from
        values - The Values materialized in the dictionary

                              int rl,
                              int ru,
                              int offT,
                              double[] values)
        Decompress the contents of this column group into the specified full matrix block.

        rl - row lower
        ru - row upper
        offT - The offset into the target matrix block to decompress to.

      • decompressToBlock

        public abstract void decompressToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                                       int[] colIndexTargets)
        Decompress the contents of this column group into uncompressed packed columns
        Parameters:
        target - a dense matrix block. The block must have enough space to hold the contents of this column group.
        colIndexTargets - array that maps column indices in the original matrix block to columns of target.

      • decompressColumnToBlock

        public static void decompressColumnToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                                           int colIndex,
                                           List<AColGroup> colGroups)
        Decompress an entire column into the target matrix block. This decompression maintain the number of non zeros.
        Parameters:
        target - Target matrix block to decompress into.
        colIndex - The column index to decompress.
        colGroups - The list of column groups to decompress.

      • decompressColumnToArray

                                           int colIndex,
                                           List<AColGroup> colGroups)

      • decompressColumnToBlock

        public static void decompressColumnToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                                           int colIndex,
                                           int rl,
                                           int ru,
                                           List<AColGroup> colGroups)
        Decompress part of the col groups into the target matrix block, this decompression maintain the number of non zeros.
        Parameters:
        target - The Target matrix block to decompress into
        colIndex - The column index to decompress.
        rl - The row to start the decompression from
        ru - The row to end the decompression at
        colGroups - The list of column groups to decompress.

                                                 int rl,
                                                 int ru,
                                                 List<AColGroup> colGroups)
        Decompress part of the col groups into the target matrix block, this decompression maintain the number of non zeros.
        Parameters:
        target - The Target matrix block to decompress into
        rl - The row to start the decompression from
        ru - The row to end the decompression at
        colGroups - The list of column groups to decompress.

      • decompressColumnToBlock

        public static void decompressColumnToBlock(double[] target,
                                           int colIndex,
                                           int rl,
                                           int ru,
                                           List<AColGroup> colGroups)
        Decompress part of the col groups into the target dense double array. This assumes that the double array is a row linearized matrix double array. This is much faster than decompressing into a target matrix block since nnz is not managed.
        Parameters:
        target - Target double array to decompress into
        colIndex - The column index to decompress.
        rl - The row to start decompression from
        ru - The row to end the decompression at
        colGroups - The list of column groups to decompress.

      • decompressColumnToBlock

        public abstract void decompressColumnToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                                             int colpos)
        Decompress to block.
        Parameters:
        target - dense output vector
        colpos - column to decompress, error if larger or equal numCols

                                             int colpos,
                                             int rl,
                                             int ru)
        Decompress to block.
        Parameters:
        target - dense output vector
        colpos - column to decompress, error if larger or equal numCols
        rl - the Row to start decompression from
        ru - the Row to end decompression at

        public abstract long getExactSizeOnDisk()
        Returns the exact serialized size of column group. This can be used for example for buffer preallocation.

        exact serialized size for column group

      • get

        public abstract double get(int r,
                           int c)
        Get the value at a global row/column position.
        Parameters:
        r - row
        c - column
        Returns:
        value at the row/column position

      • getValues

        public abstract double[] getValues()
        Get all the values in the colGroup. Note that this is only the stored values not the way they are stored. Making the output a list of values used in that colGroup not the actual full column.
        Returns:
        a double list of values.

      • getValuesAsBlock

        public abstract MatrixBlock getValuesAsBlock()
        Returns the ColGroup as a MatrixBlock. Used as a fall back solution in case a operation is not supported. Use in connection to getIfCountsType to get if the values are repeated.
        Returns:
        Matrix Block of the contained Values. Possibly contained in groups.

      • getIfCountsType

        public abstract boolean getIfCountsType()
        Returns true if in the getValuesAsBlock method returns values in groups (that needs to be counted) or individually potentially repeated values
        Returns:
        boolean

      • rightMultByVector

        public abstract void rightMultByVector(double[] vector,
                                       double[] c,
                                       int rl,
                                       int ru,
                                       double[] dictVals)
        Multiply the slice of the matrix that this column group represents by a vector on the right.
        Parameters:
        vector - Vector to multiply by (tall vector)
        c - Accumulator for holding the result
        rl - Row to start at
        ru - Row to stop at
        dictVals - The dictionary values materialized

      • rightMultByMatrix

        public abstract void rightMultByMatrix(int[] outputColumns,
                                       double[] preAggregatedB,
                                       double[] c,
                                       int thatNrColumns,
                                       int rl,
                                       int ru)
        Right multiply by matrix. for which the compressed matrix is on the left and the uncompressed is on the right. Note that there is no b argument, but the b is aggregated into the values needed for assignment and addition into output.
        Parameters:
        outputColumns - The Columns that are affected by the right multiplication.
        preAggregatedB - The preAggregated values that is to be put into c
        c - The output matrix
        thatNrColumns - The number of columns in B (before aggregation)
        rl - The row index to start the multiplication from
        ru - The row index to stop the multiplication at

      • leftMultByRowVector

        public abstract void leftMultByRowVector(double[] vector,
                                         double[] result)
        Multiply the slice of the matrix that this column group represents by a row vector on the left (the original column vector is assumed to be transposed already i.e. its size now is 1xn).
        Parameters:
        vector - row vector
        result - matrix block result

      • leftMultByRowVector

        public abstract void leftMultByRowVector(double[] vector,
                                         double[] result,
                                         int offT)
        Multiply the slice of the matrix that this column group represents by a row vector on the left (the original column vector is assumed to be transposed already i.e. its size now is 1xn).
        Parameters:
        vector - row vector
        result - matrix block result
        offT - The offset into target result array to put the result values.

      • leftMultByRowVector

        public abstract void leftMultByRowVector(double[] vector,
                                         double[] result,
                                         int numVals,
                                         double[] values)
        Multiply the slice of the matrix that this column group represents by a row vector on the left (the original column vector is assumed to be transposed already i.e. its size now is 1xn).
        Parameters:
        vector - Row vector
        result - Matrix block result
        numVals - The Number of values contained in the Column.
        values - The materialized list of values contained in the dictionary.

      • leftMultByRowVector

        public abstract void leftMultByRowVector(double[] vector,
                                         double[] result,
                                         int numVals,
                                         double[] values,
                                         int offT)
        Multiply the slice of the matrix that this column group represents by a row vector on the left (the original column vector is assumed to be transposed already i.e. its size now is 1xn).
        Parameters:
        vector - Row vector
        result - Matrix block result
        numVals - The Number of values contained in the Column.
        values - The materialized list of values contained in the dictionary.
        offT - The offset into target result array to put the result values.

      • leftMultBySelfDiagonalColGroup

        public abstract void leftMultBySelfDiagonalColGroup(double[] result,
                                                    int numColumns)

      • leftMultByMatrix

        public abstract void leftMultByMatrix(double[] matrix,
                                      double[] result,
                                      double[] values,
                                      int numRows,
                                      int numCols,
                                      int rl,
                                      int ru,
                                      int vOff)
        Multiply with a matrix on the left.
        Parameters:
        matrix - matrix to left multiply
        result - matrix block result
        values - The materialized list of values contained in the dictionary.
        numRows - The number of rows in the matrix input
        numCols - The number of columns in the colGroups parent matrix.
        rl - The row to start the matrix multiplication from
        ru - The row to stop the matrix multiplication at.
        vOff - The offset into the first argument matrix to start at.

      • leftMultBySparseMatrix

        public abstract void leftMultBySparseMatrix(SparseBlock sb,
                                            double[] result,
                                            double[] values,
                                            int numRows,
                                            int numCols,
                                            int row,
                                            double[] MaterializedRow)
        Multiply with a sparse matrix on the left hand side, and add the values to the output result
        Parameters:
        sb - The sparse block to multiply with
        result - The linearized output matrix
        values - The dictionary values materialized
        numRows - The number of rows in the left hand side input matrix (the sparse one)
        numCols - The number of columns in the compression.
        row - The row index of the sparse row to multiply with.
        MaterializedRow - A Temporary dense row vector to materialize the sparse values into used for OLE

      • scalarOperation

        public abstract AColGroup scalarOperation(ScalarOperator op)
        Perform the specified scalar operation directly on the compressed column group, without decompressing individual cells if possible.
        Parameters:
        op - operation to perform
        Returns:
        version of this column group with the operation applied

      • binaryRowOp

        public abstract AColGroup binaryRowOp(BinaryOperator op,
                                      double[] v,
                                      boolean sparseSafe,
                                      boolean left)
        Perform a binary row operation.
        Parameters:
        op - The operation to execute
        v - The vector of values to apply, should be same length as dictionary length.
        sparseSafe - True if the operation return 0 on all instances of values in v -- op(v[?], 0)
        left - Specifies if the operation is executed on the left or right side of the values contained.
        Returns:
        A updated column group with the new values.

      • unaryAggregateOperations

        public abstract void unaryAggregateOperations(AggregateUnaryOperator op,
                                              double[] c)
        Unary Aggregate operator, since aggregate operators require new object output, the output becomes an uncompressed matrix.
        Parameters:
        op - The operator used
        c - Rhe output matrix block.

      • unaryAggregateOperations

        public abstract void unaryAggregateOperations(AggregateUnaryOperator op,
                                              double[] c,
                                              int rl,
                                              int ru)
        Unary Aggregate operator, since aggregate operators require new object output, the output becomes an uncompressed matrix.
        Parameters:
        op - The operator used
        c - The output matrix block.
        rl - The Starting Row to do aggregation from
        ru - The last Row to do aggregation to (not included)

      • countNonZerosPerRow

        public abstract void countNonZerosPerRow(int[] rnnz,
                                         int rl,
                                         int ru)
        Count the number of non-zeros per row
        Parameters:
        rnnz - non-zeros per row
        rl - row lower bound, inclusive
        ru - row upper bound, exclusive

      • isLossy

        public abstract boolean isLossy()
        Is Lossy
        Returns:
        returns if the ColGroup is compressed in a lossy manner.

      • isDense

        public boolean isDense()
        Is dense, signals that the entire column group is allocated an processed. This is useful in Row wise min and max for instance, to avoid having to scan through each row to look for empty rows. an example where it is true is DDC, Const and Uncompressed. examples where false is OLE and RLE.
        Returns:
        returns if the colgroup is allocated in a dense fashion.

      • sliceColumns

        public abstract AColGroup sliceColumns(int cl,
                                       int cu)
        Slice out the columns within the range of cl and cu to remove the dictionary values related to these columns. If the ColGroup slicing from does not contain any columns within the range null is returned.
        Parameters:
        cl - The lower bound of the columns to select
        cu - The upper bound of the columns to select (not inclusive).
        Returns:
        A cloned Column Group, with a copied pointer to the old column groups index structure, but reduced dictionary and _columnIndexes correctly aligned with the expected sliced compressed matrix.

      • getMin

        public abstract double getMin()

      • getMax

        public abstract double getMax()

      • copy

        public abstract AColGroup copy()

      • containsValue

        public abstract boolean containsValue(double pattern)

        public abstract long getNumberNonZeros()

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
